entries.title: TypeScript
entries.description: Primary language for frontend and backend development, enabling type safety and maintainability.

entries.title: Node.js 22
entries.description: Current LTS version used for production workloads.

entries.title: Node.js 24
entries.description: Next-generation Node.js version under evaluation for future adoption.

entries.title: Node.js 14
entries.description: End-of-life Node.js version. Should not be used due to lack of security updates and ecosystem support.

entries.title: pnpm
entries.description: Package manager optimized for monorepos, performance, and disk efficiency.

entries.title: React
entries.description: Standard UI library for building component-based web applications.

entries.title: AWS
entries.description: Primary cloud provider for hosting, managed services, and infrastructure automation.

entries.title: Jenkins
entries.description: CI/CD tool used for legacy and specialized pipelines.

entries.title: Artillery
entries.description: Performance and load testing tool focused on modern APIs.

entries.title: PactumJS
entries.description: API testing framework focused on HTTP contract validation and automation.

entries.title: Playwright
entries.description: End-to-end testing framework for reliable browser automation.

entries.title: Bruno API Client
entries.description: Git-friendly API client for local and team-based API testing.

entries.title: Postman
entries.description: Popular API client under evaluation considering collaboration model, licensing, and alternatives such as Git-friendly tools.

entries.title: Code Review
entries.description: Mandatory peer review process to ensure code quality and shared ownership.

entries.title: Pair Programming
entries.description: Collaborative development practice to improve design, quality, and knowledge sharing.

entries.title: Trunk-Based Development
entries.description: Development strategy focused on short-lived branches and continuous integration.

entries.title: Shift-Left Testing
entries.description: Testing practices applied earlier in the development lifecycle.

entries.title: Observability by Default
entries.description: Systems are designed with logs, metrics, and traces as first-class concerns.
